intro: Campylocentrum escobariae, commonly known as the Escobariae hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
